subject: History
title: The Lost Amber Room
description: A fast breakdown of The Lost Amber Room for builders.

hook.text: A room made entirely of amber, gold, and mirrors vanished during World War II. It has never been found.

buildup.text: Created in 1701 for the King of Prussia, the Amber Room was gifted to Russia and installed in the Catherine Palace.

discovery.text: The room used six tons of amber panels backed with gold leaf and mirrors. It was called the Eighth Wonder of the World.

twist.text: Nazi soldiers dismantled it in 36 hours in 1941 and shipped it to KÃ¶nigsberg. After 1945, it was never seen again.

climax.text: Theories range from destroyed in Allied bombing to hidden in a mine, a submarine, or a secret bunker.

punchline.text: The Eighth Wonder of the World is still missing.
